📌Officials say Weinberg - whose credits include work on shows like "Scrubs" and "Politically Incorrect with Maher" - allegedly targeted women in public places under the guise of being a photographer offering them work.

_source.content: In 1986, Will Smith told Jeff Townes: "You got all of this computer shit down here but you don't have a damn fax machine! You can get a sampling guitar pedal from a Nazi in Vienna and you don't have no way of faxing a damn contract?"I had to do a double take when Will's memoir referenced Cinderella within the context of the '80s music industry. I thought that he was talking about the rock band whose members were Tom Keifer, Jeff LaBar, Eric Brittingham and Fred Coury.Will said in his book: "I hate it when people send me Instagram quotes that are supposed to be deep. Psalm 118:8 implies that it’s better to trust in The Lord than it is to put confidence in man.(SIDE NOTE - The term “Christ” is a title, not a name. It’s more accurate and allowing Him to live in you is more feasible than merely trying to imitate behavior(s).

_source.content: #LGBT #Queers #Faggots #SectualPredators #Groomers #Transgenders #SexChange #Pedos #Pedophilia #PedophilesDespite pushback, Indiana predator catchers continue stingsTrib Star ^ | December 21, 2022 | Carson Gerberhttps://www.tribstar.com/indiana/news/despite-pushback-indiana-predator-catchers-continue-stings/article_2ed110ea-12f0-5cc7-81b6-3812fd79c963.htmlFRANKFORT — For weeks, Aaron Fossnock had been texting with Julie, a 15-year-old girl he met on a dating app. Fossnock sent graphic photos of himself and asked for some in return, but Julie never obliged.Now, the two had plans to meet in the movie section at the Frankfort Walmart.The 35-year-old texted her shortly before and asked Julie to dress a little older for the occasion. When the time arrived, Fossnock was there as promised, his 10-month-old twins tucked inside baby seats sitting in his shopping cart.But Julie never showed up. Christopher Abercrombie did.Armed with his camera phone, the 42-year-old Indianapolis resident confronted Fossnock over the texts he sent to “Julie,” a decoy created by Abercrombie.“A f— 15 year old, huh?” Fossnock said upon seeing Abercrombie. The age of consent in Indiana is 16.After initially denying who he was and why he was there, the Frankfort resident eventually admitted he had sent the texts. He wasn’t going to do anything sexual, he told Abercrombie; he just wanted to hang out because he was lonely.Five days later, after Abercrombie submitted the phone with the text exchanges to police, Fossnock was arrested on a warrant for child solicitation and dissemination of matter harmful to a minor. He eventually took a plea agreement in the case and was sentenced to three years of probation.It was Feb. 12, 2021, and Abercrombie had just helped land his first arrest as the founder of the Facebook group called Exposing Predators of Indiana’s Children (EPIC).“I mean, I got 62,000 people that follow me and support me, so it feels great,” Abercrombie said recently.CATCHING IN INDIANAThe incident in Frankfort was just one of thousands of sting operations conducted in the U.S. and around the globe by groups like EPIC, which have been popping up for years on social media sites.The formula is virtually always the same: Civilian catchers create decoy accounts on dating apps and then reveal to people who respond that they are an underage girl or boy.If the conversation continues, they lure men into conversations that eventually become sexual. The catchers then set up a place to meet, where they confront the person during a livestream so their thousands of fans can watch.Some call them heroes selflessly defending children. Others see them as untrained vigilantes who sensationalize what should be hard-nosed police work.That divide in opinion is growing ever deeper as Facebook catcher groups gain more followers by the day while more prosecutors have come out against the dangers and legal pitfalls baked into how they operate.But love them or hate them, catcher groups aren’t going away, and instead have become embedded in American’s criminal justice system.In just the past three years, at least 160 groups in the U.S. have been running predator catcher operations, according to a Washington Post analysis of their social media posts. One YouTube channel tracking catchers has counted more than 920 stings by amateurs this year alone, the analysis found.In Indiana, groups like EPIC and Predator Catcher Indianapolis, which have the largest followings in the state, started gaining traction in 2020, adding tens of thousands of followers as they traveled the state livestreaming their confrontations with men looking for sex from minors.One of the most recent videos to gain attention came Oct. 22 from the Predator Catcher Muncie Facebook group, who approached a former teacher at an Applebee’s after texting with him as a decoy 14-year-old boy.The 63-year-old previously taught in Logansport schools for 39 years before retiring in 2020 and taking a job as a teacher’s aide at West View Elementary School in Muncie. In the video, he admitted to texting the decoy and confessed to the group that “this might be the dumbest thing I’ve ever done.”But unlike the Frankfort arrest, no charges have been filed against the former teacher.That’s because after years of dealing with vigilante catcher groups, Delaware County Prosecutor Eric Hoffman is fed up with their tactics and refuses to take their cases.‘I CANNOT CONDONE CATCHERS’In the parking lot of a Planet Fitness in Ohio in 2017, a catcher approached a man who had been corresponding with a fabricated 14-year-old-girl.

#LGBT #Queers #Faggots #SectualPredators #Groomers #Transgenders #SexChange #Pedos #Pedophilia #Pedophiles
Despite pushback, Indiana predator catchers continue stings
Trib Star ^ | December 21, 2022 | Carson Gerber
https://www.tribstar.com/indiana/news/despite-pushback-indiana-predator-catchers-continue-stings/article_2ed110ea-12f0-5cc7-81b6-3812fd79c963.html

FRANKFORT — For weeks, Aaron Fossnock had been texting with Julie, a 15-year-old girl he met on a dating app. Fossnock sent graphic photos of himself and asked for some in return, but Julie never obliged.

Now, the two had plans to meet in the movie section at the Frankfort Walmart.

The 35-year-old texted her shortly before and asked Julie to dress a little older for the occasion. When the time arrived, Fossnock was there as promised, his 10-month-old twins tucked inside baby seats sitting in his shopping cart.

But Julie never showed up. Christopher Abercrombie did.

Armed with his camera phone, the 42-year-old Indianapolis resident confronted Fossnock over the texts he sent to “Julie,” a decoy created by Abercrombie.

“A f— 15 year old, huh?” Fossnock said upon seeing Abercrombie. The age of consent in Indiana is 16.

After initially denying who he was and why he was there, the Frankfort resident eventually admitted he had sent the texts. He wasn’t going to do anything sexual, he told Abercrombie; he just wanted to hang out because he was lonely.

Five days later, after Abercrombie submitted the phone with the text exchanges to police, Fossnock was arrested on a warrant for child solicitation and dissemination of matter harmful to a minor. He eventually took a plea agreement in the case and was sentenced to three years of probation.

It was Feb. 12, 2021, and Abercrombie had just helped land his first arrest as the founder of the Facebook group called Exposing Predators of Indiana’s Children (EPIC).

“I mean, I got 62,000 people that follow me and support me, so it feels great,” Abercrombie said recently.

CATCHING IN INDIANA

The incident in Frankfort was just one of thousands of sting operations conducted in the U.S. and around the globe by groups like EPIC, which have been popping up for years on social media sites.

The formula is virtually always the same: Civilian catchers create decoy accounts on dating apps and then reveal to people who respond that they are an underage girl or boy.

If the conversation continues, they lure men into conversations that eventually become sexual. The catchers then set up a place to meet, where they confront the person during a livestream so their thousands of fans can watch.

Some call them heroes selflessly defending children. Others see them as untrained vigilantes who sensationalize what should be hard-nosed police work.

That divide in opinion is growing ever deeper as Facebook catcher groups gain more followers by the day while more prosecutors have come out against the dangers and legal pitfalls baked into how they operate.

But love them or hate them, catcher groups aren’t going away, and instead have become embedded in American’s criminal justice system.

In just the past three years, at least 160 groups in the U.S. have been running predator catcher operations, according to a Washington Post analysis of their social media posts. One YouTube channel tracking catchers has counted more than 920 stings by amateurs this year alone, the analysis found.

In Indiana, groups like EPIC and Predator Catcher Indianapolis, which have the largest followings in the state, started gaining traction in 2020, adding tens of thousands of followers as they traveled the state livestreaming their confrontations with men looking for sex from minors.

One of the most recent videos to gain attention came Oct. 22 from the Predator Catcher Muncie Facebook group, who approached a former teacher at an Applebee’s after texting with him as a decoy 14-year-old boy.

The 63-year-old previously taught in Logansport schools for 39 years before retiring in 2020 and taking a job as a teacher’s aide at West View Elementary School in Muncie. In the video, he admitted to texting the decoy and confessed to the group that “this might be the dumbest thing I’ve ever done.”

But unlike the Frankfort arrest, no charges have been filed against the former teacher.

That’s because after years of dealing with vigilante catcher groups, Delaware County Prosecutor Eric Hoffman is fed up with their tactics and refuses to take their cases.

‘I CANNOT CONDONE CATCHERS’

In the parking lot of a Planet Fitness in Ohio in 2017, a catcher approached a man who had been corresponding with a fabricated 14-year-old-girl.

_source.content: The Mushroom Principle or How the Anglo-EuroZionist “Democracies” Work: Keeping the People in the Dark and Feeding Them ShitAfter the dust settled after the US invasion of Iraq in 2003, the US finally had to admit, after searching left and right, back and forth, up and down, that there were no weapons of mass destruction (WMDs) anywhere in Iraq. I was then surprised by their admission, as I fully expected their propaganda machine to continue ad nauseum with the lies, to distribute numerous external photos of closed magazines claiming that they were full of WMDs (but were actually empty). Ultimately, however, there comes a time when full-blown lies must be unleashed, especially when all U.S. personnel in Iraq could never, ever verify any find of WMDs, writes Eric Arthur Blair .So it turned out that the testimonies of experts such as Hans Blix, Scott Ritter (UN weapons inspectors) and Andrew Wilkie (Australian military intelligence officer) that no significant WMDs existed in Iraq at the time were 100% justified. The US Deep State 1(and his satraps) spared no effort to discredit, punish and even kill those who dared to contradict the American “WMDs in Iraq” fabrications. Andrew Wilkie was removed from his position. They taunted and bullied Hans Blix endlessly, leading Blix de Anglo to call the WMD liars “those bastards” who used “bad faith” to start a “witch hunt.” Scott Ritter was character assassinated, tried and convicted of unrelated matters in what was clearly a trap 2 . A warning to opponents of the Deep State: Their surveillance tentacles are ubiquitous and they can easily put child pornography on your computer as an excuse to throw you in jail.In the UK, the story of Dr. Even more tragically, David Kelly, a scientific weapons expert who contradicted Tony Blair's claim that Saddam could deploy weapons of mass destruction in 45 minutes. Kelly, who had no psychiatric history, was found dead in the woods with a severed wrist. Very little blood was found at the crime scene, suggesting that his wrist had been cut elsewhere and his body then moved. The bogus Blair named good-ole-boy Hutton the head of a phony “investigation” that dutifully labeled Kelly's death a suicide and exonerated his buddy Blair and the English authorities. 3In the US, the psychopath in charge (the flaccid dick Cheney, not the limp, crab-infected Bush) turned viciously against even Republican loyalists and long-lost CIA operatives. I refer, of course, to Republican loyalist Joe Wilson, who proved that Saddam Hussein had never sought uranium from Niger, which Wilson duly reported to Cheney. However, Cheney persisted in spreading that lie to the public, which Wilson then openly disputed. In retaliation, Scooter Libby, Cheney's lap dog, publicly revealed that Valerie Plame (Wilson's wife) was a CIA agent, a disclosure illegal under US law because it destroyed her career and could endanger her life. What happened then? Scooter was found guilty and convicted in a court of law, but was later granted a presidential pardon.The stinking corruption, devious duplication and hypocrisy that plague the Beltway quagmire have become even more sordid over the past two decades. 4Everyone should be reminded of the historical facts described above, as they are still of paramount importance today. It is in the interests of the US Deep State to impose a general amnesia on the global public regarding the war crimes they have committed in Iraq (as well as in Afghanistan, Vietnam and Korea, not to mention the more than 50 despicable “interventions” abroad, from Iran in 1953 to Guatemala in 1954 and one of the most egregious – Chile in 1973). Only through the imposition of such widespread historical amnesia can the Deep State sanctimoniously point the finger at Russia today for their “illegal, unprovoked invasion of Ukraine”What has changed today? The mechanisms of “narratives” have been exponentially tightened. In 2003 it was still possible to read occasional pieces in the "respectable" press, such as the BBC, NY Times, Washington Post or The Guardian, that questioned the official narratives, especially the fabricated justifications that the Deep State for their invasion of Iraq. Since then there has been a systematic purge of all honest investigative journalists who dared to question the Deep State's narratives. Most notably, Chris Hedges, Pulitzer Prize-winning chief of the Middle East Bureau of the NY Times, was removed from his position for his righteous opposition to the US invasion of Iraq. Another quantity, who was summarily fired from The Guardian (despite his contribution to the 2014 Pulitzer Prize win) was Glenn Greenwald. Voices of reason, such as those of Noam Chomsky, have long since been sidetracked and shunned.Read morehttps://www.frontnieuws.com/het-paddestoelprincipe-of-hoe-de-anglo-eurozionistische-democratieen-werken-het-volk-in-het-donker-houden-en-ze-stront-voeren/?utm_source=plugin&utm_medium=notification&utm_id=253898

However, Cheney persisted in spreading that lie to the public, which Wilson then openly disputed. In retaliation, Scooter Libby, Cheney's lap dog, publicly revealed that Valerie Plame (Wilson's wife) was a CIA agent, a disclosure illegal under US law because it destroyed her career and could endanger her life. What happened then? Scooter was found guilty and convicted in a court of law, but was later granted a presidential pardon.

The stinking corruption, devious duplication and hypocrisy that plague the Beltway quagmire have become even more sordid over the past two decades. 4

Everyone should be reminded of the historical facts described above, as they are still of paramount importance today. It is in the interests of the US Deep State to impose a general amnesia on the global public regarding the war crimes they have committed in Iraq (as well as in Afghanistan, Vietnam and Korea, not to mention the more than 50 despicable “interventions” abroad, from Iran in 1953 to Guatemala in 1954 and one of the most egregious – Chile in 1973). Only through the imposition of such widespread historical amnesia can the Deep State sanctimoniously point the finger at Russia today for their “illegal, unprovoked invasion of Ukraine”

What has changed today? The mechanisms of “narratives” have been exponentially tightened. In 2003 it was still possible to read occasional pieces in the "respectable" press, such as the BBC, NY Times, Washington Post or The Guardian, that questioned the official narratives, especially the fabricated justifications that the Deep State for their invasion of Iraq. Since then there has been a systematic purge of all honest investigative journalists who dared to question the Deep State's narratives. Most notably, Chris Hedges, Pulitzer Prize-winning chief of the Middle East Bureau of the NY Times, was removed from his position for his righteous opposition to the US invasion of Iraq. Another quantity, who was summarily fired from The Guardian (despite his contribution to the 2014 Pulitzer Prize win) was Glenn Greenwald. Voices of reason, such as those of Noam Chomsky, have long since been sidetracked and shunned.

RCP averages: Joe's job approval rating spread is -8.7%.

(kan)YE is self-destructing.

Ilhan Omar from the Foreign Affairs committee.👍 Bravo, Kevin. Next, issue subpoenas.
SCOTUS will decide Moore vs. Harper and determine whether the Constitution gives state legislatures unfettered authority to regulate elections.
Kagan says SCOTUS must find common ground again. No thanks. YOU really must uphold the Constitution, as you swore in your oath.
